children.name: lyrics b2
children.definition: lyrics the words of a song : lời bài hát
examples: paul simon writes the lyricsformost of his songs.
sing the lyrics
he's very good at singing his own lyrics though, on the albums and mp3s that i've got.
ladysmith black mambazo sings the traditional music of africa

children.name: refrain x
children.definition: refrain part of a song or poem that is repeated, especially at the end of each verse: điệp khúc

children.name: words u
children.definition: wordsthe words that are sung as part of a song : lời ca
examples: i know the tune, but i've forgotten the words.
the words to
many people don't know the words to the country's national anthem.

children.name: verse b2
children.definition: verse one of the parts into which a song is divided : đoạn nhạc
examples: each verse was sung as a solo and then everyone joined in on the chorus.
she sang the first verse of ‘amazing grace’.

children.name: chorus x
children.definition: chorus part of a song which is repeated several times after each verse : điệp khúc
examples: join in a chorus
i'll sing the verses and i'd like you all tojoin inthe chorus.
most of the kids were able to join in the chorus.

children.name: tune a2
children.definition: tune the main series of notes in a piece of music, without the words(use this especially when you think it is nice to listen to) giai điệu
examples: i recognize the tune, but i can’t remember what it’s called.
the music box plays the tune ‘send in the clowns.’
i’ve heard that tune before, but i don’t know the words to the song.
that’s a nice tune.
to the tune of sth(= using the same tune as another song)
the song was sung to the tune of "amazing grace".
play a tunehe played a tune on the piano.
hum/whistle a tuneshe was humming a little tune to herself.
write/compose a tunethey wrote many great tunes together in the 80s.
catchy/memorable(= one that is easy to remember )his songs have simple words and catchy tunes.
the theme tune/signature tune(= the tune at the beginning or end of a television programme etc)the theme tune from the movie 'titanic'
a show tune(= a tune from a musical )broadway show tunes
a dance tunethe dj played some bouncy dance tunes.
a hymn tunea rousing hymn tune

children.name: melody c2
children.definition: melody the main series of notes in a piece of music that has many lines being played at the same time: giai điệu chính
examples: the song has a simple melody and beautiful lyrics.
melody is not the central element in martino’s compositions - rhythm is more important.
he played a few well-known melodies.
his songs are always strong on melody.
the song has a simple melody and beautiful lyrics.
a sweet/pretty/lovely melody(= pleasant )the pianist played a sweet melody.
a good/strong melodyit’s hard to find rules about what makes a good melody.
a simple melodyi like songs with a simple melody.
a catchy melody(= one that is easy to remember )with their catchy melodies, the songs are likely to be hits.
a haunting melody(= used about a beautiful melody, especially one that is rather sad and which you remember for a long time )he began to play a soulful, haunting melody.
a plaintive melody(= sad )the song's plaintive melody expresses perfectly the feeling of loneliness that she feels after her lover has gone.
a lilting melody(= rising and falling in a pleasant way )lennon’s voice enters with a gently lilting melody.
a pop melody(= one that is typical of a pop song )the album’s perfect pop melodies make it probably the best record this year.
have a melodyall his songs have good melodies.
play a melodyat this point, the flute begins to play the melody.
sing a melodyshe sang the melodies as though she loved them.
carry the melody(= play or sing the melody, while other voices or instruments play other notes)the soprano voice carries the melody.
the melody line(= the melody, compared to the other parts of the music )the melody line is often set too high for people singing in church.

children.name: piece b2
children.definition: piece / piece of music an arrangement of musical notes that has been written by sb (use this about music without words) bản nhạc
examples: the cd contains two pieces performed by the tokyo string quartet.
it’s difficult to know ahead of time whether an audience will like a new piece of music.
play/ sing a piece (of music)

children.name: song a2
children.definition: song
examples: a)[c] a short piece of music with words that you sing : bài hát
we used to listen to pop songs on the radio.
they sat round with guitars, singing songs.
b)[u] songs in general :
the bravery of past warriors was celebratedinsong.
he was so happy he wanted to burst/breakintosong(= start singing).
sing a songhe started singing a little song.
play a song(= with singing and musical instruments )the band played a lot of their old songs.
perform a song(= in public )he doesn’t like performing his songs live.
write/compose a songdo they write their own songs?
record a song(= onto a cd so that it can be sold )the song was first recorded in 1982.
good/greatthat’s a great song!
neware any of the songs on the album new?
oldpeople always want to hear their old songs.
a pop/folk songi love all those '60s pop songs.
a popular s ong(= used mainly of songs written before the 1960s )a popular song from the 1930s
a love songhe is releasing an album of love songs for valentine’s day.
a protest songthey were singing old protest songs from the 1960s.
a beatles/rem etc songcan you play any beatles songs?
burst/break into song(= start singing )the crowd spontaneously burst into song.

children.name: composition b2
children.definition: composition a piece of music that sb has written - use this when you are considering the way the music is written:tác phẩm
examples: stone’s composition ‘idaho’ became a national hit when benny goodman recorded it for columbia.
zwilich’s flute concerto was nominated for best contemporary classical composition.
this concerto is one of her earlier/later compositions.
a composition by jazzman dave brubeck, called ‘chromatic fantasy’
a mixture of traditional songs and original compositions

children.name: work b2
children.definition: work a piece of music, especially a longclassicalone - use this inwrittenorformalcontexts: tác phẩm
examples: the performance began with two of mozart’s early works.
handel’s ‘messiah’ is one of the most majestic musical works ever written.

children.name: a piece of music for dancing
bolero x
children.definition: bolero a type of spanish dance, or the music for this dance
examples: ravel's bolero

children.name: cha-cha x
children.definition: cha-cha/ cha-cha-cha a piece of music written for an energetic modern dance, originally from south america, involving small fast steps and movement of the bottom from side to side

children.name: dance b1
children.definition: dance a piece of music which you can dance to :
examples: the band was playing a slow dance.

children.name: rumba x
children.definition: rumba/ rhumba a type of dancing, originally from cuba, or the music for this

children.name: samba x
children.definition: samba the type of music played for this dance

children.name: tango x
children.definition: tango a fast dance from south america, or a piece of music for this dance

children.name: waltz x
children.definition: waltz a piece of music intended for this type of dance :
examples: a strauss waltz

children.name: sonata x
children.definition: sonata a piece of music with three or four parts that is written for a piano, or for a piano and another instrument : bản xô nát
examples: a piano sonata

children.name: symphony x
children.definition: symphony a long piece of music usually in four parts, written for an orchestra : bản giao hưởng
examples: mahler's 9th symphony
bruckner’s fifth symphony

children.name: serenade x
children.definition: serenade a piece of gentle classical music in several parts : dạ khúc
examples: 'moonlight serenade'

children.name: parts of a large piece of music
passage b2
children.definition: passage a short piece of writing or music which is part of a larger piece of work : phân đoạn
examples: an orchestral passage
students can slow down the tempo or loop a particular section of music to practice difficult passages.

children.name: part x
children.definition: part the music that one type of instrument or voice within a group plays or sings : phần chơi, hát của một người
examples: the violin part is difficult.
the choir sings in four-part harmony.

children.name: coda x
children.definition: coda specialized a piece of music at the end of a longer piece of music, which is usually separate from the basic structure : đoạn cuối
examples: the coda is often more technically difficult than the rest of the piece.

children.name: songbook x
children.definition: songbook a book with the words and music of many songs

children.name: fanfare x
children.definition: fanfare a short loud piece of music played on a trumpet to introduce an important person or event: khúc nhạc nghi lễ
examples: a trumpetfanfare

children.name: a piece of music for one or more musicans
solo b2
children.definition: solo a piece of music for one performer : bản solo
examples: a gorgeous piano solo
she has to play a trumpet solo in this piece.
parker's solo on 'a night in tunisia' was so amazing that the pianist backing him simply stopped playing.

children.name: trio x
children.definition: trio a piece of music that has been written to be performed by three people:
examples: the final item in today's programme is beethoven's trio in b flat.

children.name: duet x
children.definition: duet a song or other piece of music sung or played by two people

children.name: number x
children.definition: number a piece of popular music that forms part of a longer performance : tiết mục, bài hát
examples: ‘the show’s not very good.’ ‘we can leave after this number if you want.’
nell carter also appeared and performed a couple of upbeat numbers.
madonna sang several numbers from her latest album.
the show was brilliant, from the opening number to the end.

children.name: track b2
children.definition: track one of several songs or pieces of music on a cd or other musical recording :
examples: the album includes four previously unreleased tracks.
track three is my favourite one.

children.name: introduction b2
children.definition: introduction/ introinformal a short part at the beginning of a song or piece of music
examples: the song's great, but the introduction's a bit too long.
